text: Characterization of the human <extra_id_0> platelet/endothelial cell adhesion molecule-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter : identification of a <extra_id_0> GATA-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> binding element required for optimal transcriptional activity .

<extra_id_0> Platelet/endothelial cell adhesion molecule-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> PECAM-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) is a 130-kD member of the Ig gene superfamily that is expressed on platelets , endothelial cells , and certain leukocyte subsets .

To examine the factors controlling vascular - specific expression of <extra_id_0> PECAM-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , we cloned the 5'-flanking region of the <extra_id_0> PECAM-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene and analyzed its transcriptional activity .

text: 5'-Rapid amplification of cDNA ends ( 5'-RACE ) analysis showed that transcription initiation occurred at several closely spaced nearby sites originating approximately 204 bp upstream from the translation start site .

Analysis of the sequence immediately upstream from the transcription initiation site ( TIS ) showed no canonical TATA or CAAT elements , however an initiator element commonly found in TATA - less promoters encompassed the TIS .

5'-serially truncated <extra_id_0> PECAM-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter segments cloned in front of a luciferase reporter drove transcription in both a lineage - and orientation - specific manner .

Putative cis - acting control elements present within a 300-bp core promoter included two <extra_id_0> ets <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> sites , an <extra_id_0> Sp1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> site , tandem E-box domains , two GATA - associated sites ( CACCC ) , an <extra_id_0> AP-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> binding site , and a GATA element at -24 .

Mutational analysis showed that optimal transcriptional activity required the GATA sequence at position -24 , and gel-shift assays further showed that the <extra_id_0> GATA-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transcription factor , but not <extra_id_0> GATA-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , bound to this region of the <extra_id_0> PECAM-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter .

text: Understanding the cis - and transacting factors that regulate the tissue - specific expression of <extra_id_0> PECAM-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> should increase our understanding of the mechanisms by which vascular - specific gene expression is achieved .
